assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
There is no Member State that includes Data on the Web Best Practices W3C in their national catalogue with The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets.

CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
Data on the Web Best Practices gives some advice on how to publish data on the web. However, it does not make data available on the Web, or it does not make data available as structured data. So, this specification does not support any level of maturity of Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data.

Data on the Web Best Practices W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/en/

statement:

W3C Process document:
https://www.w3.org/2018/Process-20180201/#Policies

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.

The specification was produced in 2004, and it has been followed at European level. These Best Practices have been evolved together with the application profile used in the European Platform for the reusability of interoperability Solutions, Joinup. 

W3C Reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
This document provides Best Practices related to the publication and usage of data on the Web designed to help support a self-sustaining ecosystem. Following these Best Practices will facilitate interaction between publishers and consumers. Therefore, this specification does not foster the creation of innovative solutions.

W3C Reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
Data on the Web Best Practices gives some advice on how to publish data on the web. It encourages and enables the continued expansion of the Web as a medium for the exchange of data. It does not directly foster the visibility of data, but the usage of this best practice can help to implement solutions to foster the visibility of data and services of public administration.

Data on the Web Best Practices W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
The purpose of this document is not related to reduce administrative burden. However, it encourages and enables the continued expansion of the Web as a medium for the exchange of data. Best Practices cover different aspects related to data publishing and consumption, like data formats, data access, data identifiers and metadata. Therefore, this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification. 

W3C Reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of W3C Best Practices within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

CENELEC search tool catalogue:
https://www.cenelec.eu/dyn/www/f?p=104:107:0::::FSP_LANG_ID:25

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of W3C Best Practices is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

W3C reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
This document does not define a cross-sector reusable data model, but it defines a Best Practices on how to publish data on the web.

W3C Reference:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

assessment_title: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Data on the Web Best Practices W3C
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Data on the Web Best Practices gives some advice on how to publish data on the web. However, it does not support the principles of linked open data.

Data on the Web Best Practices W3C:
https://www.w3.org/TR/dwbp/

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
